comment:
*

A thin wrapper around the java.util.Date class that allows the JDBC * API to identify this as an SQL TIME value. The Time * class adds formatting and * parsing operations to support the JDBC escape syntax for time * values. *

The date components should be set to the "zero epoch" * value of January 1, 1970 and should not be accessed.

variables.name: serialVersionUID
variables.comment:
* Private serial version unique ID to ensure serialization
    * compatibility.

methods.name: public void setTime(long time)
methods.comment: * Sets a Time object using a milliseconds time value. * * @param time milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT; * a negative number is milliseconds before * January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT

methods.name: public static Time valueOf(String s)
methods.comment: * Converts a string in JDBC time escape format to a Time value. * * @param s time in format "hh:mm:ss" * @return a corresponding Time object

methods.name: public String toString()
methods.comment: * Formats a time in JDBC time escape format. * * @return a String in hh:mm:ss format

methods.name: public int getYear()
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a year component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked * @see #setYear

methods.name: public int getMonth()
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a month component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked * @see #setMonth

methods.name: public int getDay()
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a day component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked

methods.name: public int getDate()
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a date component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked * @see #setDate

methods.name: public void setYear(int i)
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a year component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked * @see #getYear

methods.name: public void setMonth(int i)
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a month component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked * @see #getMonth

methods.name: public void setDate(int i)
methods.comment: * @deprecated This method is deprecated and should not be used because SQL TIME * values do not have a date component. * * @exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if this * method is invoked * @see #getDate
